alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:26PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Etowah and central Cherokee Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 326 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Crossville to Aurora. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gadsden, Hokes Bluff, Centre, Cedar Bluff, Sardis City, Leesburg, Reece City, Sand Rock, Gaylesville, Tabor Road, Cherokee Rock Village, Aurora, Cornwall Furnace Park, Slackland, Western Weiss Lake, Noccalula Falls, Eastern Weiss Lake, Weiss Dam, Gadsden Steam Plant and Yellow Creek Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
